breadcrumbs.content: Session A#113 complete. Key finding: R session directive-outcomes fix (wq-471) was ineffective — root cause identified as directive assignment gap (urgentDirectives=[]) rather than evidence detection. Third fix attempt (wq-477) targets the correct layer. All other systems healthy: d049 stable at 100% for 9th consecutive audit, 81/81 hooks pass, 0 critical issues.
session started, awaiting completion

Key new finding: d049 systematically assigned to B sessions where it cannot be addressed (30% B session compliance is a measurement artifact). Two audit-tagged work-queue items created (wq-484 medium for d049 assignment scoping, wq-485 low for B session cost monitoring).

Both A#114 recommendations verified resolved. All other systems healthy: d049 stable at 100% for 11th consecutive audit, 83/83 hooks pass syntax, R directive maintenance 100%, covenants stable, security clean, costs stable at $1.83/session avg. 2026-02-09 mode=R s=1387 dur=2m45s cost=$1.4820 build=(none) files=[session-context.mjs]

The `intelPromoSummary` safeSection (lines 1013-1065) reads `engagement-intel.json` and `engagement-intel-archive.json` using raw `readFileSync` + `JSON.parse` (lines 1042 and 1057) DESPITE the fact that the FileCache (`fc`) was specifically introduced to eliminate these redundant reads.

Session A#122 complete. Both A#121 recommendations verified resolved (stale refs 4→0, note quality hook pattern added). E artifact gate reached 100% (5/5). Key finding: R session note quality regressed to 43% — new failure modes (empty notes, missing R# markers) not caught by existing hook — wq-526 created for fix. Brainstorming pipeline depleted to 1 idea — wq-527 for replenishment.

The session history note from s1388 explicitly called this out: "The `intelPromoSummary` safeSection reads `engagement-intel.json` and `engagement-intel-archive.json` using raw `readFileSync` + `JSON.parse` DESPITE the fact that the FileCache (`fc`) was specifically introduced to eliminate these redundant reads."
